Reviews.Title: Nice to look at...painful to listen to...doesn't last long (UPDATE)
Reviews.Author: D. Bouley
Reviews.Content: I bought the Coby LEDTV2326 after researching affordable tvs to replace a failing Audiovox LCD TV/DVD combo I've had in my kitchen for six years.  It gets a lot of use, as the kitchen is the hub of our house.  I decided to forego the built-in DVD player, as convenient as it has been, because I wanted to keep the price down, and I have two extra DVD players just collecting dust in the basement.  One sits atop the fridge now.Upon unboxing, I was impressed with the thin, sleek build of the Coby.  Five minutes later it was hooked up and searching for channels...it's that easy.  I have it connected to standard cable, so it found the expected 58 or so SD channels.  I was surprised to see that it also found 45 HD channels...I expected some, thanks to its QAM tuner, but not nearly that many.  Bonus.HD picture quality is beautiful.  I can't say anything more.SD picture quality is sub-par when compared to other HDTVs I own, and others I've seen.  It's not great...but its watchable.DVD quality (480p) is quite good.  Not HD, but very crisp.  Blows SD cable away.One more thing to note about the picture - I can definitely see bright spotting around the perimeter when the screen is totally black...this indicates poor back (edge) lighting.  Were it my main tv, it would go back for this.  It's a kitchen tv.  No big deal.Now for the sound...I've never heard worse sound quality from any tv in my life...and I'm a videophile, so I've experienced a lot of tvs.  It sounds like you're trying to listen via a pair of crappy headphones sitting on the table in front of you.  It's literally unbearable.  Thank God they included a headphone jack.  I bought a $25 pair of decent computer speakers to solve the problem.  It sounds great now.Overall, if you're looking for a good display for mainly HD or DVD duty, and you're willing to augment (replace) the included sound with a cheap pair of computer speakers, buy this tv.  It's definitely worth two bills.  If, however, you don't like the idea of separate speakers and just want a plug-and-play tv, buy something else...one with forward-facing speakers (hard to find, but obvious due to the perforated grilles you'll see under the screen).  Any display this size with down-facing speakers (the majority) is going to sound like crap.11/14/11 UPDATE - after five short months of use, the LED edgelight is failing.  It will start to flicker, then go completely black.  If you look closely, you can see that the LCD screen is still producing an image, but there is no backlight.  With the piddly 90 day warranty, I'm out $200.  Stick to the major brands.  Don't buy this.

Reviews.Title: Decent TV at a great price; Perfect for saving money.
Reviews.Author: Glenn
Reviews.Content: Knowing that the difference in quality of small television sets is marginal, I was willing to try an off-brand set. I picked up the Coby LEDTV1526 from a local electronic store chain for $88. The TV was a bargain for what I paid, despite its shortcomings. I bought it primarily to use as a monitor (which it does fine through the HDMI input but with some problems with the VGA input), but it works fine as a TV as well. In general, the picture is just as good as that of my 32" Vizio, and the sound is loud enough for any SMALL room. The small size and low weight of this set make it ultra-portable too. The remote works fine, and I like its build quality and large buttons. The energy use of this set is incredibly low; According to the energy guide label, you can expect to use three dollars of energy in a YEAR if you use the set five hours a day. The set has a few problems that can definitely be overlooked for the price, but I feel should be known:1. The viewing angle is awful. You need to look at it dead-on, or colors start to go. Not a problem from close distances or if you can position it so that it will be watched dead-on.2. The TV angles slightly upward (I think < 5 Degrees), but I'm not sure exactly how much. I may have set it up wrong, but I wouldn't know that because it doesn't come with instructions on how to attach the base. I know Coby is a cheap brand, but come on!3. My unit had a glaringly obvious, bright green dead pixel, and the store I bought it from had a "no returns" policy. It isn't worth paying $50 to ship to and from Coby for a replacement, though. Obviously not a problem if purchased from Amazon, though it speaks somewhat of Coby's hit-or-miss quality control.4. Only 1 HDMI input (common problem for TVs this size). Excellent selection of other inputs for a TV this size though (1 AV, 1 Component, among others).5. The rear VGA port is hard to use. You need to angle in a VGA cord and screw in a single side first before the other can be screwed in. The TV is recognized as a 24", Coby-made set by default, and depending on how you're using the VGA port, you may not be able to get the correct resolution (1366x768; For a monitor of a computer running Ubuntu, a Linux-based OS, the best I could get was 1360x768).6. The TV produces different picture quality depending on the ports you use, and not in the way most would think. When using a 1080i source through the antenna/cable input, pictures appear a little painting-like. When using HDMI, they appear more natural.7. Weak speakers, but it is a 15" set and with so little room to put speakers in, that is expected. After adjusting to the sound, it is sounds surprisingly good.8. The power cord comes loose VERY easily. It won't fall out if you're keeping it in one place or just moving it slightly, but it sure isn't a tight fit.9. This is the big one. From everything I've heard, Coby itself more or less abandons you after the 3 months labor warranty is up (their 12 months parts warranty is meaningless). Because the set is so cheap, I don't think an extended warranty for more than 1-2 years is worth it though.10. The over-the-air and other TV tuners work well. You have to rescan completely if you want to find new channels (there is no option just to find new ones which is a bit disappointing), a disappointment as an antenna user. The worst problem if you use an antenna is that to see signal strength, you have to dig deep into the menus of the television.11. The black levels on this set are very unimpressive (this is a 15" set, and this was expected). Other colors are vibrant, though the set has trouble with some of them (especially reds and browns), producing a blocky appearance. It's tough to describe, but you'll notice it up close.12. The TV always has a blue light on at night. Oddly, you have the option to turn the light off from the remote when the TV is on, but not off.

Reviews.Title: LED Critique
Reviews.Author: William Moberg
Reviews.Content: I purchased this TV to replace a 10 inch analog TV mounted under a cabinet in our kitchen. I have it mounted instead from the wall behind,using an articulating wall mount. I am generally pleased with the TV. On the positive side I am able to connect directly to my cable without a cable box since it has a QAM tuner. On the negative side the picture is not as good as other LCD TV's that I have looked at. In particular, the analog stations are much poorer in quality than my old analog TV produced. The HD channels are much better but still lack the black contrast of other sets.  Interestingly, my cable channel is not available in HD without purchasing an upgrade package. I have only the basic cable service but the network channels are digital. The response to the color adjustment and audio controls is dismal. Almost no effect. The sound is 'tinney' and no amount of adjustment corrects this. As for other common limitations of LCD TVs, the viewing angle is critical. The screen arrived tilted downwards approximately 5 degrees from vertical which is noticeable with this effect. It appears to have a tilt, but when I called the factory they reported that there is no adjustment for tilt ?? Since I am using a wall mount this is not an issue for me, since there is provision for tilt in the mount. I plan to keep this set, but wish that I had been able to 'kick the tires' in a local retail outlet before purchasing. It is not available locally in any of the big name stores. There is precious little available in screen sizes less than 19 inches.

Reviews.Title: very disappointing experience
Reviews.Author: Dewey Hylton
Reviews.Content: i already knew the sound wasn't going to be stellar based on previous reviews. but i wasn't expecting the product to cost more than advertised. ADORAMA sold me the tv via amazon, and it arrived without obvious damage. plugging it in, however, produced lots of colorfully lit pixels all over the screen - with no input. the display is simply broken, and supplying an image doesn't change the faulty pixels. i'm estimating 15-20% of the pixels are faulty. okay, so that's the unit itself.i clicked away on amazon's forms to generate a return request. 2 days later, adorama writes to say that they won't work with me because i accepted the package that was delivered. they point me to COBY, the manufacturer.so i hit up coby, just to find that not only do i have to ship the unit to them - i also have to pay for them to ship me a replacement. this unit just became $50 more than advertised, meaning i could have purchased a better unit from a more reputable company in the first place. meh.my recommendation: don't bother with either ADORAMA or COBY. just save yourself the headache, and possibly some money in the end.picture of the factory-fresh unit in all of its brokenness: [[...]]

Reviews.Title: Incredible buy for 99.99
Reviews.Author: happy
Reviews.Content: what and incredible TV for 99.99$ I dont know what everyone is complaining about but this tv is awsome...The picture quality in highdef is incredible..If you want big sound buy a big TV ...the sound for this tv is fine and quality is great...dont ever hesitate to buy this tv for kitchen or bedroom you will be very happy....thanks amazon

Reviews.Title: waste of money
Reviews.Author: Amazonian
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV in January 2012 and thought it was a good deal at the time. As of last week, the TV no longer turns on.

Reviews.Title: coby ledtv1526
Reviews.Author: GJT
Reviews.Content: very nice picture. very frugal on electric usage.the only problem is the viewing angle is narrow.when you viewing from left or right or up and down from center, picture tends to fades out

Reviews.Title: Bright & Clear But Only 6 Bit Color!
Reviews.Author: Steve C
Reviews.Content: This TV is a good value for only $79 at Frys. It looks nice and seems to be well made. The full size remote is better than most, it looks nice and is easy to use. If you want to go to a channel and punch in 8, for instance, it know to go to 8.2 which saves a lot of button pressing. The program guide shows information about the current program and upcoming programs also which other sets such as Emersons can't do. The tuner is more sensitive than most and can pull in even the weakest low power stations. I was able to get all the stations from Phoenix and Tucson with my roof top antenna, approximately 65 channels.  The picture is bright and sharp with bright colors and very, very bright whites. The picture is so white that it takes some getting used to because it makes blues look almost too blue. The tint control can be adjusted for only red or green, there's no way to tone down the blue. The display has that shiny, clear coating that is all the rage now instead of having a coating that eliminates reflections. The case is also very shiny so it's best to use this set in a darkened room without any light sources behind you or you will have a lot of reflections from the screen.  The Color intensity is turned up way too high by default and needs to be backed off a lot to keep skin tones from looking much too red. While the resolution is only 1366X768 that is fine for a display of this size. The biggest problem however is the 6 bit color that can only display 262k colors instead of 16.7 million colors like other sets. That means it will lose a lot of small detail in the picture because color gradients can't flow smoothly and you will get strips of different solid colors instead. It looks OK from a distance but if you check up close everything looks more like a painting than a photo, kind of like that ad for the stock broker Charles Schwab where everyone's face is painted in.The field of view is narrow from left to right and up and down also. You get a great view straight on, which is fine for one person, but move a little off to the side or up and down and you don't see anything much. If you put the TV on a night stand by the bed and adjust it to watch while sitting up you won't see much if you lie down. It does tilt a little but might need a book underneath the base to tilt it for best viewing angle. There are mounting holes on the back for a stand with better movement however. The manual says the set has 6 Watt amplifiers and built in Dolby digital decoder for Superior Sound but that's a joke. The speakers in the bottom of the case can't be any bigger than 1" diameter and sound worse than listening to a pocket size transistor radio. There's nothing but mid range audio, sort of like a tin can on a string. It sounds so bad that it's not even suitable for casual viewing unless you use headphones or get a good pair of 2.1 powered speakers but they are cheap at Goodwill.My biggest concern is with the LED backlights. White LEDs don't last very long and there's no information about replacing them or even if they are replaceable when they start to get dim. While people are used to red or green LEDs lasting a long time there is no such thing as a white LED because they only produce one single color. White is produced by taking a blue LED that is coated with yellow phosphor, like the kind on the front of a TV picture tube, that glows when the LED activates it so the combined result of yellow and blue looks white. The life of a white LED depends on the quality of the phosphor and can very from a couple of weeks to 2-3 years depending on how expensive it was so the life of this set remains to be seen.Also, the set really does turn on by itself like others have said. It's happened a couple of times aready.

Reviews.Title: Great Picture quality but disappointing sound quality
Reviews.Author: Christopher M. Sansbury
Reviews.Content: Great bang for your buck!!! Picture is amazing, very slim, just the sound quality is just a lil disappointing. My 13" tube tv I had before sounded way better. I quess being the speakers are on the rear make is sound different. I replaced it to have more counter space in my kitchen but just seems that the tv I had before sounded way better. Over all I still love this tv but if sound quality is very important to you reserch in store first!

Reviews.Title: Great for digital cable - not great for analog cable Coby LEDTV1926 19-Inch 720p LCD TV
Reviews.Author: georgzel
Reviews.Content: We have standard analog cable TV in our house with no digital cable boxes needed on any of our 4 tvs. This Coby TV cannot display analog channels brightly. The picture on the HD channels was clear and bright but when watching analog channels the picture was very dim, low contrast and had muddy colors. we returned it and were very impressed with Amazon's return procedures, they were the smoothest, most customer-friendly return with prepaid return shipping and extremely fast credit back to our credit card. We were disappointed in this product, but thrilled and pleased with the outstanding customer-centric return procedures that Amazon has.

Reviews.Title: Great value and picture
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I bought one of these at another store at a great price (a returned item) and have been really impressed so far.  It has a much sharper and brighter picture that seems a lot more realistic than the 20" Vizio that broke down and was replaced by this Coby.The only minor complaints that I have are that the audio out jack is located in the middle of the back instead of at the side and that it only has one HDMI connector.For the money, this is a terrific TV!

Reviews.Title: cheap price, cheap product
Reviews.Author: aha_experience
Reviews.Content: Bought this at Fry's for about $170, new in box.  While it it is attractively thin and has the features I wanted (except good sound), I struggled to find a color balance so that faces wouldn't look gray and pallid while not blowing out bright colors like football fields.  The color is, at best, a compromise.  Then, the TV started coming on by itself after having been turned off.  This is not pleasant in the middle of the night.  Finally, 15 days after the 90-day labor warranty expired, the unit refused to turn on.  It was a waste of money.Update: It came back to life, but the other problems remain.  If you want an inexpensive LED TV and don't mind these issues, this one might work for you.

Reviews.Title: Great little TV
Reviews.Author: Dempsy Winans
Reviews.Content: We bought this TV for use in our travel trailer and it is a perfect TV for the job.  It is very lightweight, thin and easily sits on the smallish space reserved for it in the trailer.  It was super easy to set up and they even included the batteries for the remote control.  It got here sooner than they said it would and was in perfect condition.  It's a sleek looking TV with an EXCELLENT picture.  It has several preset modes for the picture but I played around with the custom ones until I had it set just the way I like it, with very vivid colors and sharp, crisp contrast.The only down side to the TV is the sound quality.  It's got tiny little speakers in it so I don't expect big sound from them, but it is the only weakness I can think of to point out.  And, if you have surround sound, that won't matter at all.I would definitely recommend it to a friend.

Reviews.Title: Awesome
Reviews.Author: Renee
Reviews.Content: Cool little TV - set up a breeze.  Installed in our exersize room where the sound is not a big issue (it is a little tinny) - attached it to cable and PC (netflix, amazon movies and sling box)  piece of cake - wish there were a few more set up options ( would like to only source cable & vga and not show the others) but for $99 on the lightning deal this is an awesome TV.

Reviews.Title: Worst TV ever made....do not buy it.
Reviews.Author: dk
Reviews.Content: I purchased 5 of these pathetic tvs and 2 have failed within 6 months and they only have a 3 month warranty.Now I see why the 3 month warranty so they don't have to deal with these pieces of junk.

Reviews.Title: Wouldn't recommend
Reviews.Author: keanae128
Reviews.Content: I went through 2 COBY LEDTV2326 23 - Inch 1080p LED HDTV/Monitors in less than 3 months.Purchased the first unit from a local store:  After two months the screen went blank and no sound.  Purchased the second unit from here; after One monthe the same thing happened.  Received a refund for both purchases.The volume was sent on maximum and you could bearly hear the sound.Will not purchase a COBY product, ever again.

Reviews.Title: DON'T BUY,YOU WILL BE SORRY
Reviews.Author: randyc
Reviews.Content: I bought this tv at the begining of december on a gold box special.By the middle of april it was dead. would not turn on. blue light would temporeley brighten, then dim , no picture, nothing. i have not contacted coby yet as warranty was only 90 days. i cant decide if having it fixed will be throughing good money after bad..But one thing is certain, i will never buy another coby product again. CAN YOU SAY CHEAP JUNK. i have owned many tv's but never had one die this quickly...........

Reviews.Title: Quit working after 5 months.
Reviews.Author: Mom29
Reviews.Content: Was a great tv until it stopped working after just five months. It just won't turn on anymore. No matter what I do. Really disappointed in this product. Will never by this brand again.

Reviews.Title: Sound quality
Reviews.Author: Tad
Reviews.Content: We found that TV's voice is very harsh. After adjusting the treble to "0" and base to maximum, the voice became somewhat acceptable. The TV must be equipped with a very tiny speaker.

Reviews.Title: Great Little TV
Reviews.Author: Amy M
Reviews.Content: I received this via UPS (more quickly than I had anticipated, by the way) yesterday afternoon.  I hooked it up last night.  After a little user error, (I thought the hand auto-screw was missing, but it was actually screwed into the base of the t.v. already.  I called Coby's customer service and talked to a great guy named Brandon who helped me figure that out.) I was able to set up the television very easily.  Set-up was a breeze.  The picture is amazing.  I just have it hooked up to my blu-ray player since I don't have a cable line in my bedroom.  My blu-ray player has wi-fi and I can watch Netflix and the like on my new t.v.  Again, the picture is just great.I was a little worried about sound quality, considering some of the other reviews I had read.  Fortunately, that wasn't a problem with my t.v.  In fact, when I turned on a movie, the sound blasted out so loudly, I literally jumped.  I had to turn it way down.  So, the sound is great on this thing!It's only been a day, but I haven't found anything wrong with it yet.

Reviews.Title: Died in less than one year
Reviews.Author: K. Correa
Reviews.Content: Bought this based on the three star overall rating, which I figured was fine considering the low price.  The unit worked fine for ten months and then, last night, just - didn't.  No warning, no fade-out, nothing.  It just won't turn on any more.  Warranty period is super short, and apparently they charge you for shipping + labor (which could easily add up to the cost of the tv), so it looks like we're just out $100.  After the fact, my husband searched out some reviews not on Amazon and it looks like this is a very common problem, with the universal opinion of this product being much lower than the three star rating here would lead you to believe.  I would definitely recommend NOT buying this tv, even at a great price, unless great means $20.  Caveat emptor - personally, I'm off to shop the Columbus sales for a better quality replacement.

Reviews.Title: Didn't make it a year.
Reviews.Author: Alexander Jauregui
Reviews.Content: I could comment on its picture quality and other aspects of a TV, but will not.I bought it for 99 dollars on black Friday 2011. It is now September and it won't turn on. You shouldn't buy this. It's cheap, but don't buy it. Seriously don't buy it.This is my first non Samsung TV I've purchased (I own two sammys that I've had for years) and I kind of regret it now. I like it when my TV's turn on. I didn't spend a lot of money, but a 19 inch tv shouldn't really cost that much to begin with. I'll be going back to my 18 year old FUNAI tube TV that fits into the spot where this went. Its just not worth it to buy a 19 inch TV that will crap out on you in under a year. It's still in warranty so I'll see what can be done about it.I'll update this with progress on COBY's customer service, though I can't imagine it will be good.

Reviews.Title: Dead in 6 months
Reviews.Author: Martin H Christiansen
Reviews.Content: Purchased the 19" model (Coby LEDTV1926 19-Inch 720p LED HDTV) as Christmas gift. After very minimal use it has gone to a completely black screen. The warranty is is good for only 90 days. I was very satisfied with the picture and overall quality up to this point.

Reviews.Title: Ok for the price
Reviews.Author: Ima Rascal "Rascal"
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV on a special deal to replace an old 13 inch boulder in a spare bedroom. I read as few of the reviews about the sound being bad. While the sound is not top notch it's not as bad as a couple reviews made it sound. In the room I have it in now it is plenty loud enough and clear enough as well. Setup was easy. I have it connected directly to the cable line and did the auto program to set the channels. It auto scans both digital and analog. The analog channels come in decent and digital channels look great. If you are looking for a TV to go into the garage or mancave or spare bedroom this is not a bad piece. The reason I give it 4 stars is because mine arrived with a dead pixel. I would return it but the deal was too good and it's in a spare room and won't get alot of use.

Reviews.Title: My Little TV
Reviews.Author: Jo Jo
Reviews.Content: I love my little TV. I replaced my kitchen TV with this model and I have not been disappointed. As far as viewing angles, its called turn the TV toward you. No problem.  I never used the last TV as much as I use this TV. I AM WELL PLEASED

Reviews.Title: Do not buy Coby Products!
Reviews.Author: Catalina
Reviews.Content: After limited use, the Coby LED TV has failed.  Coby technical representatives give no response to e-mails.  I am amazed that Amazon sells products of such poor quality and zero customer support.  I have lost faith in Amazon....and as for Coby...their reputation will soon catch up to them.

Reviews.Title: For shame, Coby, for shame.
Reviews.Author: Buyer
Reviews.Content: I can't believe a company actually sells hdtvs this blurry. I was even willing to make a compromise and just turn the sharpness all the way up, yet the image for my ps3's av multi input is worse than a standard tv over 10 years old. Images and text are inexcusably blurry. The audio sounds like it's coming from a laptop speaker.This is a waste of time and money. This wouldn't be such a harsh review if there weren't other similar ones about this product; If this was just a damaged unit, I can understand but apparently this is the actual design. I'm not buying any more tvs from Coby. This is terrible quality. Coby LEDTV2326 23-Inch 1080p LED HDTV/Monitor, Black

Reviews.Title: Disappointed
Reviews.Author: ManhattanPrimeFan
Reviews.Content: I purchased this TV for my kitchen table.  I needed something small with an HDMI input.  This 15" TV from COBY was the smallest one I could find.  Unfortunately, the HDMI input didn't make the picture as perfect as it is on my SONY TV's.  While the picture is sharp and ghost-free, when I look at the image up close, I see solid blocks of color, no gradient shading.  It looks like a paint by numbers picture.  But, from a distance the picture is acceptable.My biggest complaint is the viewing angle is very narrow.  There is almost no 'sweet spot' for viewing.  It seems worse than looking at the worst laptop screen.  If the middle of the screen is good, then the top or bottom of the screen is faded, with washed out black tones.  The same goes for the left to right viewing angle.  So, even though the manufacturer's site says the contrast ratio is an impressive 3,000:1, most of the screen does not benefit from that rating.When I tried to adjust the brightness and contrast in hopes of helping the situation, the range of adjustments is barely visible.  It is so difficult to see the adjustments, because part of the screen is washed out due to the narrow vertical and horizontal viewing angles.My second biggest complaint is the quality of the sound.  It's really tinny.  I have to turn the Treble all the way down and the Bass almost all the way up.  I'd rather listen to the sound through my A/V system instead.  My MacBook Pro has better sound.I have HD DirecTV and the remote is supposed to be able to control the volume on any TV.  I was able to set it to control my SONY and SHARP TV's, but none of the COBY numbers worked for this TV.  Not sure whether it's too new or what.Pros:  Compact & Thin  Thin  Bright  Well laid out Remote Control  Energy saving  Runs coolCons:  Very limited viewing angles - Horizontal & Vertical  Sound quality  HD picture is not up to par  Unable to program DirecTV to control this modelGiven how long LCD TV's have been around, I was really disappointed by the picture quality - especially the limited viewing angles.  I wish some of the big manufacturers like SONY, Panasonic, Samsung & Sharp would come up with a small, HDMI connected, LCD/LED TV.  Fortunately, this TV cost me less than $110 from ABT Electronics.  So, if anyone knows of one that doesn't suffer from the cons I've listed, please let me know.  Then, this one will go into my next yard sale.

Reviews.Title: If youre upgrading from a tube
Reviews.Author: Joswayze
Reviews.Content: I think its great.  It isnt the best tv but for a 19inch tv i think you cant ask for much more.  I don't need surround sound on the thing i just needed to replace my tube with another small tv.  The stand felt a little cheap but otherwise the tv feels really solid.  I have only tried digital but it seems to me pretty clear picture and for the lightning deal at 99 dollars, I feel it was a pretty good deal.

Reviews.Title: NEVER BUY COBY AGAIN
Reviews.Author: purplepanther
Reviews.Content: This brand new COBY LEDTV 1926 worked for few DAYS.  That's it.  Not for a year or month, not even a WEEK.  I couldn't believe that this kind of product is on the market.  When I turn it on, nothing happens.  Once in like 30 times, it turns on.  It explains why the warranty is only for 90days.  Get another brand!

Reviews.Title: cheap tv
Reviews.Author: fustratred nj
Reviews.Content: Bought this 19 coby tv on a lighting deal for a Christmas present for our daughter.  The picture was good and sound ok for a 99 dollar tv. However 9 short months later the tv stop working entirely the backlight would come on for 10 seconds and shut off. After some research it seems they have problems with there main board, and under sized cheap capacitors. You get what you pay for.  Stay away from this brand.  will definitely never buy another COBY product again

Reviews.Title: ggreat find
Reviews.Author: sandiaarunswithdeer
Reviews.Content: Product has a great picture,new as it said and shipped fast,features and plug ins are a dream, great size...the internal NTSC is easily hooked up with small antenna..channels are auto searched

Reviews.Title: Perfect TV for the price
Reviews.Author: Delphi
Reviews.Content: I ordered this TV for my garage and am very please with it.  It was shipped within a day and arrived a week later.I am using an over-the-air antennae (small set of rabit ears) so I only get the local broadcast stations, but it still auto-programmed in 55 digital stations.The picture quality is pretty good; the remote is easy to use; and the sound is Ok, although I have to keep the volume on max; all of which is what I expected after reading other reviews.All in all, I am very please with this TV, especially for the price ($99 lightning deal).

Reviews.Title: Excellent value!
Reviews.Author: Gregory Ritz
Reviews.Content: I was going crazy trying to buy an inexpensive monitor.This little baby has all the inputs you can possibly want, HDMI, VGA, Composite, S-Video and video.Great picture, easy to use.Much, much cheaper than a monitor and you get a TV for the same price!

Reviews.Title: Get what you pay for
Reviews.Author: Trisha
Reviews.Content: The television was as it was described (flat and black), however, the HDMI ports did not work. . . it was a birthday gift and we had to return it the following day. We ended up paying slightly more for a similar flat-screen, HDMI ready television at a local electronics store, but everything worked when we got it home.  Birthday boy was happy!!

Reviews.Title: Great little TV with a few glitches
Reviews.Author: amr0816
Reviews.Content: I got this television about 2 months ago and I not had any trouble out of it except for the fact that it will sometimes turn on by itself. I will often walk in the door from work and the tv will come on a few minutes later when I'm in a different room. Its nothing I would return it for, I've just started unplugging it when I leave but it can be a bit of an energy waster if you don't notice whats going on.Overall I would say this is a great television other than its ghostlike qualities of randomly turning on by itself. It's in my living room (tiny apartment) and it works great for watching movies and television. Picture is crystal clear!Fantastic buy for a small space or dorm room.

Reviews.Title: Coby LEDTV2326
Reviews.Author: J. Toso "JT"
Reviews.Content: Nice basic little TV.  Made in the USA.  Slim, light weight, nice picture.  I have this and the 22" model for my daughter.  I like the picture and very competitively priced.  As for some low rankings for sound.  I absolutely found this to be untrue.  These are small tvs for small rooms.  I have mine in a new dining room addition of my house.  The sound is great.

Reviews.Title: Quality is very poor
Reviews.Author: Nemesis77
Reviews.Content: Bought this TV 5 Feb 2014. It was defective upon arrival Feb 7, 2014. Tried Amazons repair option and was told company was OUT OF BUSINESS! but they did provide a 30 guarantee. At least I will get my money back. I would have been left holding the preverbal bag after 30 days. I think that all 3rd party vendors or Amazon should include a statement in their adds to the effect that this is a discontinued item. If Amazon is not requiring 3rd part vendors to state this they should do so. Thankfully, they set was bad upon delivery and not 1 yr. later!So, before you buy a product  I strongly suggest you do an internet search & confirm that the company is still in business; otherwise you will be stuck with a poor TV with absolutely no warranty This at least will allow you to get  Amazon's warranty. Caveat emptor !

Reviews.Title: DO NOT BUY - BAD TV, BAD BUSINESS
Reviews.Author: Kim
Reviews.Content: Bought this TV for $99 Dec 2012. It was great! ... Until 9 months later when the screen starting flickering. To my knowledge, there was a 1yr manufacturer's warranty; however, they are apparently OUT OF BUSINESS! I googled contact info and was met with just a logo screen on each link. A BBB report noted that as of Sep 2013, mail to the business was being returned. Thankfully, I had paid the extra $15 for warranty with SquareTrade & they reimbursed me (in full) for the TV.So, before you buy COBY, do an internet search & confirm that the company is still in business; otherwise you will be stuck with a poor TV with absolutely no warranty (unless you buy one on Amazon).

Reviews.Title: this tv is not worth the money
Reviews.Author: roderick j. rolling
Reviews.Content: the TV did not even last one year very disappointed will not purchase it  again.sorry I ever purchased it.because it sucks

Reviews.Title: Failed after about a year.  Just say no to Coby.
Reviews.Author: Roddoc "rod"
Reviews.Content: My Coby failed after about a year or so.  Got it from Fry's for $75. It was ok but didn't really get a lot of use. (approx. 40 hours) Now it maybe would turn on for 15 minutes, have bad picture colors & then go blank.  Neither remote nor controls on back would work.  other times it would turn on but picture never came on.  You are really taking a chance with this Coby.  I will certainly thinks long and hard before I ever buy any Coby product again.

Reviews.Title: I have been buying this model “Coby LEDTV1526” since April 2012.
Reviews.Author: KarmaPolice
Reviews.Content: I have been buying this model “Coby LEDTV1526” since April 2012. They are being used for car side monitors for restaurants. Every time I install one/ usually two, the staff just loves them. They are clear and just the right size. To date: I have purchased - (12) in 2012 and (8) so far in 2013. I will continue to purchase these for our restaurants until they change the model. The price does vary….5 Stars - just a great productI would recommend this TV to anyone.

Reviews.Title: Good for kitchen use
Reviews.Author: Joanne Schreiner
Reviews.Content: I wanted a small lfat screen TV for my kitchen.. This one is just fine.  The picture is good (not the best, but perfectly acceptable.)  Sound quality is good (also not the best, but perfectly acceptable).  I use it only when I am working in the kitchen, so the price and size drove the purchase.  I'm happy with it.  I could not find a 15-inch TV at any store.  Found this one on other web sites but I prefer to shop Amazon because of service and delivery (the TV arrived within 48 hours.)

Reviews.Title: Broke in less than a year
Reviews.Author: Mitia01
Reviews.Content: This product was bought on black Friday last year. It's broken now. It won't turn on or off. We called the manufacturer. Their joke of a warranty was to take it to a TV repair shop, find out the part that needs to be replaced, then call Coby and send them $30.00 for the replacement part. THEN pay someone else to have it fixed. It's a joke

Reviews.Title: Clear, Bright Picture and Good Sound Quality!
Reviews.Author: Assunta Sciarretta
Reviews.Content: This TV is a good value!  It's the perfect size for sitting right on a kitchen counter.  The screen is relatively large but super-slim, so it hardly takes up any space.  I first used it to connect to my laptop computer, so I could watch an online course with great picture and sound.  (Cords for attaching the TV to my laptop were not included, so I needed to buy a 15-pin D-sub cable and a 3.5 mm stereo audio cable Cables Unlimited PCM-2240-15 SVGA Cable With 3.5mm Male to Male Audio (15 Feet, Black).  However, they were inexpensive, easy to pick up on Amazon, and were delivered to my door within 24 hours.)  The picture is clear.  The set-up was easy - a key point for me.  The TV could easily be mounted to a wall, too.  It comes with a stand onto which the TV is attached by a screw, so it is not wobbly like a stand onto which the TV just fits into place.

Reviews.Title: Stopped working after 6 months- warranty is crap
Reviews.Author: Josh
Reviews.Content: STAY AWAY.  The TV stopped working after about 6 months.  It will occasionally work, but only about 1 out of 10 times after leaving it off for a long period of time.  Coby's warranty is basically useless.  They do not repair the item at all.  I can take it to a repair center of my choice and they will provide parts, but I am still on the hook for labor after 3 months.  They did give me the option of sending it back for repair (even though they said they don't repair it), and pay $50 for this.  Which may lead to a new unit, but after shipping and the $50 you are the cost of the TV.  Anyway, lesson learned.  This is the first low-end TV I have purchased, and it will be the last.  I have had a couple other Coby products (electronic picture frames), and they have all been junk.  Stay as far away from this junk as possible.As for the TV, the picture was good, sound was below average, and the reliability and quality stink.

Reviews.Title: Quit working after limited use
Reviews.Author: Jeff Hooker
Reviews.Content: Purchased as christmas present for our child. Realized it was a low end product, but the tv doesn't work at all after only a few months. 90 day warranty should have been a red flag. Will never buy from this manufacturer again.

Reviews.Title: Blue light on then off.  Dead tv used as a spare too.
Reviews.Author: BC "BC"
Reviews.Content: Bought this tv and had it setup in the dining area used a more of a backup/on occasion use.It just started doing the blue light on then goes off issue everyone else is reporting.What a waste of money. Bad warranty as I just found it.Will Amazon stand behind this or just sell a bad product?

Reviews.Title: Buyer Beware!
Reviews.Author: Keith
Reviews.Content: This was one of Amazon's lightning deals during their Black Friday promotion in 2011.  For $99.99, I thought it was an AMAZING deal, and until recently it was.The bad:*  Slow response time between remote control button press and television response*  The television died approximately 8 months after purchase (about 7 months after it was first plugged in)*  Coby's telephone and e-mail support are worthless.  Their only suggestion was to unplug the unit for 30 minutes, then plug it back in.My options are now:  Sell it for parts on EBay, take it into a local electronics store and spend $100, or I can ship it (at my cost) to Coby and send a $50 money order along with it in order to cover diagnostic costs, which doesn't include labor costs for actually repairing the unit.The good:*  Picture was crisp, while it lasted*  Lots of ports for different inputs

Reviews.Title: Coby LEDTV1526 15-Inch LED TV 720p 60 Hz with HDMI
Reviews.Author: online 1200
Reviews.Content: Barely had this BRAND NEW TV and it's CRAP! Turn it on and the screen flashes for 2 seconds and the TV turns itself back off! Terrible! Don't buy!

Reviews.Title: They put the K in Kwality
Reviews.Author: Bob
Reviews.Content: I just purchased two of these and both must be returned.  One has the metal edge of the LCD panel showing a quarter of an inch below the bezel.  For the other, the VGA input shows a jittery image but freezes so the cursor does not appear.  Both have a bug where, when switching from a certain channel to another, the screen goes black and the set must be turned off and back on to recover.  Not all channels, just two.  The picture looks terrible on both, washed out and grainy, and changing settings does not improve it.I have two of the 1525 and one 1524 and they have been very good.

Reviews.Title: Coby HDTV
Reviews.Author: Fran
Reviews.Content: Nice little set.  Main problem is that Time Warner Cable does not have a code for this manufacturer so I have to use two remotes to use the set.  Annoying.  If more people buy this brand and request coding, it will be added.

Reviews.Title: Great for the price
Reviews.Author: Brizzle
Reviews.Content: I received this TV yesterday.  I've hooked up to both analog and digital and both pictures seem decent....especially for the price of $99.  Sound is small but sufficient.This is a replacement for a guest bedroom 27" CRT that has a large footprint on its stand.  With this TV I've gained about 8 sqft of floor space, which of course makes me happy.  This could also make a good travel tv if you are a tailgater or RVer.  Considering the price, you don't have to worry too much about messing it up.Pros:* Cheap* Decent picture* Small form factorCons:* The power cord could be a little longer* Non name brand - not sure how long this will last.For my purposes this TV fit the bill.  Don't set your expectations too high and I think you will like it too.

Reviews.Title: Good value for the price
Reviews.Author: Stephen Pickering "Irregular Joe"
Reviews.Content: This TV is a good buy for a value TV.  It would be a very good choice for a den or bedroom, or for a spare portable TV.  The picture is very sharp and has good color and brightness.  Blu-Ray through HDMI looks great at 720P and 1080P.  SD via Coaxial cable looks good, not as sharp as HDTV, but not as mushy and blurry as on some other value TVs.  Other reviews have mentioned the LED brightness bleeding into the black picture.  It is annoying when the screen is black, but nearly imperceptible when video is playing.  As another reviewer noted, this is acceptable in a spare TV, but it does keep this set from being a good choice for your primary TV.  This TV also works well as a computer monitor.  The screen resolution from the VGA connection is sharp and clear, making this an excellent computer monitor.  Sound is adequate, not great.  This has been noted in many reviews.  Keep in mind that this TV is very thin, as are most LED TVs.  Therefore, the speakers are also very thin.  Thin speakers are not typically the kind to produce room-filling, robust sound.  For a small room, the sound will be adequate.  Connecting a set of computer speakers will enhance the sound a great deal without busting anyone's budget.  Overall, this is an excellent choice for a TV you will use occasionally.

Reviews.Title: Coby 19-inch LED TV
Reviews.Author: Mr. David Green
Reviews.Content: Arrived promptly as usual from Amazon. Bought this on the cyber Monday deal week at $99.99. Has all the features that I need for the guest room, no dead pixels, turned on out of the box fine, tried with HDMI seems fine and also XBOX 360 lead without any issues. Just waitin for the wall mount now to arrive, again from Amazon.Edit.. had this tv a while now , still works great and found a code that works for the Dish Network too now ....506 works for me fine.

Reviews.Title: Coby LED TV
Reviews.Author: Joan
Reviews.Content: I love this TV for my kitchen.  I looked at all the other kitchen TV's, but found this one to be the best for me.  This model sits a top of your counter, so you would need space for it.  Standing, that is when it is in the stand, it measures, 16 inches wide and 12.75 inches tall and about one and half inches in depth.  The stand is 6 inches in depth.  It is very light weight; has a good picture (colors are bright); sound is a bit tinny, but acceptable.  I would recommend this TV.

Reviews.Title: DO NOT BUY!
Reviews.Author: Thomas J. Mulvey
Reviews.Content: This is the only negative review I have ever given a product purchased from Amazon.  This television will not turn on any more with only sixteen months of very limited use.  The sound wasn't great, but we could live with it - for the price.  When I searched the internet for our problem (TV will not turn on), I found it was a very common problem.

Reviews.Title: Saved a few $ and got less for the $250
Reviews.Author: Robert R Saunders
Reviews.Content: The set is slow to respond to commands, on, change channels, volume. The volume is weak and not a product I would ever consider purchasing again. You can say that the lower the price usually the lower the quality. I should have invested more into a better TV.

Reviews.Title: I Hate This Awful Piece of Junk! Tomorrow it Goes to Goodwill!
Reviews.Author: REnninga "renninga"
Reviews.Content: I hate it.  Awful, awful, awful.The sound is so weak and lacking bass that you will not be able to hear it even in a kitchen or bathroom without purchasing auxiliary full-range speakers. 9 times out of 10 when I turn it off, either with the remote or with the off button on the rear, it will turn itself back on anytime at random from a few seconds to a few hours later.It is such a problem that I have to remember to turn the volume all the way off before turning off the TV so that when it turns itself back on in the middle of the night there is at least a chance it will not wake me.It will also not save its programming. Randomly, about once a week, it completely dumps everything programmed into the TV (channels selection, sound settings, brightness preferences, etc,. and I have to then spend 20 minutes completely through the setup process again.I have had this awful piece of junk almost 4-months, and today we packed it back in the original box and tomorrow it will be dropped-off at Goodwill and we will go by a REAL television.Avoid COBY like the plague, because if it doesn't get recalled for fire hazards or other safety concerns just doesn't work anyway.It may be low cost, but if it doesn't work properly, "cheap" is actually too expensive!

Reviews.Title: Poor quality product, not worth cost of item, failure inevitable.
Reviews.Author: Michael G. Broome
Reviews.Content: All good (for July, Aug, Sept, Oct, Nov) - now a mere # month's later - Dec - product failed.  Do NOT purchase this product.  Quality as noted by other purchasers will not sustain and even if you save at first, it will cost more (another tv) sooner than later.

Reviews.Title: Skip it!
Reviews.Author: Keith G. Johnson
Reviews.Content: Crapped out on us about 3 months after we bought it.  I didnt pay too much for it, but since then I haven't bought a bargain-brand electronic.  I highly recommend putting a few more dollars in and getting a better brand.

Reviews.Title: Angles
Reviews.Author: KEVIN S WALTON
Reviews.Content: Horrible viewing angles. Hard to see unless you are looking down at the tv.  Not a great unit. Wouldn't purchase again.

Reviews.Title: Quit working after 6 months of light use.
Reviews.Author: K. Gilliland
Reviews.Content: This TV quit working about 6 months after purchase. It  was a TV for our bedroom that I pretty much only used a few times a week and now it will not turn on. It worked one morning then I turned it off and that afternoon would not come on. Not happy and not worth the money.

Reviews.Title: Poor Choice
Reviews.Author: Chuck
Reviews.Content: Poor audio quality and stopped working in less than 6 months...out of warranty.  Research showed this to be a common complaint

Reviews.Title: Well it lived through its Warranty
Reviews.Author: BULLDG "Seriously Funny Guy"
Reviews.Content: What can I say. We bought it in July of 2012 and it failed in October of 2013. As I said, it lived through its warranty.Not impressed.

Reviews.Title: worthless
Reviews.Author: Duane
Reviews.Content: didn't work as TV or monitor. tipped over. static poor sound. Fuzzy picture. Sent it back. So what was supposed to be a great Black Friday deal was a waste of money; I'd never buy Coby brand again.

Reviews.Title: Worked Great for 6 Months
Reviews.Author: Mark
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV for my son to play his xbox.  It worked great for 6 months.  Now it doesn't work at all.  When my son tried to call the manufacturer, no one ever answered the phone.  Don't waste good money on this item.

Reviews.Title: Cheap and nice product
Reviews.Author: C. Wong
Reviews.Content: Got this from Amazon on black Friday, thought it would be a really cheap unit, when it arrived it was slim and thin and the picture quality is awesome!

Reviews.Title: Works well as a spare tv
Reviews.Author: C. Wollin
Reviews.Content: We've had this little tv for several months now and have used it in the camper, the kitchen, and as a second screen for my laptop.  In the camper, we had to tilt it down to just the right angle to see it, but other than that, it has worked well.  It's very light and thin and that makes it easy to move around to where you need it.

Reviews.Title: Great/ Should make larger size
Reviews.Author: Kellan
Reviews.Content: This is a great product. I got it a couple months ago and it is still working perfectly. I use it every day. The only problem is the size. For the price it is sold at it could be at least a 16-Inch monitor.Overall, its a great product

Reviews.Title: Great little tv for our kitchen/dining area
Reviews.Author: James A Peterson
Reviews.Content: This has reallly worked out well for our kitchen/dining area. Crisp, clear picture and easy viewing. The volume cotrol could go higher, but that may just be my hard-of-hearing ears!

Reviews.Title: Good buy
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: This was a good buy. It did what I wanted and the price was great. I am using it to display video from a dvr so the RCA connector was a must have.

Reviews.Title: T.V
Reviews.Author: Laurel Friday
Reviews.Content: Very pleased with product. The clarity is extremely good for a small LEDTV.  I also have the 17in. Coby and was very pleased with it.  For the price you can't go wrong!

Reviews.Title: Quite a surprise!
Reviews.Author: Damian "Scotty Ranking©"
Reviews.Content: Where I'm from, the COBY is considered cheap and inferior, so when I told my friends I was purchasing a COBY 23 inch LED TV, I received quite a few harsh remarks.However, when the TV arrived, and I mounted it on my bedroom wall, they were quite impressed by the product. The TV functions quite well, and the price was awesome! Makes me regret not taking a larger size, but all  in all I really cannot complain. COBY has earned my respect.

Reviews.Title: DON'T BE CHEAP! SPEND A LITTLE MORE ON A NAME BRAND!!!
Reviews.Author: Denny
Reviews.Content: To all buyers who see this TV as a good way to save some money, don't waste your time!  This TV is a POS, it cosmetically looks good but has a poor picture and broke in the first hour I had it on!!!  I made the mistake of being cheap and not wanting to spend a $179 on a name brand, don't make the same the mistake as me.

Reviews.Title: Great tv for a spare bedroom (or other small room)
Reviews.Author: Too-Tall
Reviews.Content: the picture is bright and clear. the tv takes about a second to fully turn on (old school of tube tv's). theres a blue LED light on the front that can be turned on or off when the tv is on, however when the tv is off.. the little power light remains on. odd in my opinion.I bought this for my small guest room and a roku to go with it, so when i have guests over they have entertainment to enjoy until others are awake in the house, or if they want to relax with some streaming tv.the ONLY thing i didnt like was as of early december 2012, when i bought this, it was delivered on my porch with NO plain brown packaging around it. just a brightly colored box that lets the world know you have a new tv unattended on your porch. So unless thats been fixed, make sure you are home when it comes.Update: lowered from 5 stars to 4; Why? it randomly turns itself on. whether you are in the room or not, it will just randomly turn on for no reason AT ALL. so if you get one, check on it every so often to see if it turned itself on. I'm still happy with it as a spare bedroom tv for guests; but yeah its a little troublesome that it does that

Reviews.Title: Good value for the price
Reviews.Author: Julie
Reviews.Content: This is a good TV for the money.  It is a bedroom TV that is used for late night TV.  The picture is clear and sound is OK.  Super lightweight and was easy to set up and get going.

Reviews.Title: Great fit in my kitchen
Reviews.Author: iebonyl
Reviews.Content: Just the right size for my kitchen.  Good picture.  For the price, it's a bargain. I have DirecTV.  The only problem I had was setting the TV up using the AV cable with the DirectTV box.  When I connected the AV cable to the DirecTV box, my picture was in black and white.  I could not get it to show the picture in color.  When I connected the TV to the DirectTV box using a HDMI cable, I got a beautiful color picture.

Reviews.Title: Good TV for the money
Reviews.Author: starstruck
Reviews.Content: This is a very slim attractive and compact LED TV. I find the color to be exceptional for this price of TV and although others have found fault with the sound quality I cannot. I didn't expect it to sound like a high quality home theater system but it is perfectly adequate for a small room which is where you are likely to be using a 19" TV anyway. I currently have it hooked up to my computer as a second monitor and find that to work quite well also. The resolution and clarity seems to be quite good and I am overall quite satisfied with it. I highly recommend this TV if you are looking for a 19" moderately priced TV.

Reviews.Title: Nice picture and very versatile!
Reviews.Author: E. Swope
Reviews.Content: I was honestly surprised by how nice the picture is on this TV, very crisp and vivid but the colors warmer than many.  I like it!  After much searching and comparing we bought a Panasonic TV some months back and while the picture is very crisp, the colors are not as warm or realistic as on this TV. The picture also compares favorably to our large screen Toshiba, but that has a lower resolution. This set is capable of 1080p (though several other options are available in the settings menu).  The sound, while not great, is not that bad.  It's about average for small TV speakers.  The volume however, is not great.  While I could see the picture well at a distance of 20 feet, the sound was barely audible.  If this is going to be used in a large room, separate speakers are necessary (or highly recommended).  The remote is also pretty picky.  You need to be close and have it pointed directly at the receiver or it won't work.  One  of the things I like best about this set is the number of connections it offers.  There are component and composite connectors as well as HDMI. As one who struggled for a long time with an older set which was difficult to connect anything to, I really appreciate this.  This set can use both our old equipment (e.g. VHS player) and new.  It also has a VGA plug so it can be used as a monitor (which is what I had originally intended) however, this is an area where I feel it falls a bit short (and why I gave it 4 rather than 5 stars).  The stand is not adjustable/ flexible.  It doesn't swivel.  The angle can not be adjusted, nor the height.  As a  TV that is fine.  It is thin and light enough to easily mount on a wall, but I doubt I could get the viewing angle I like on a desk.  With a wall mount, all that can be adjusted in the frame.In sum, the set has a great picture, but falls a little short on sound.  It is very flexible because of the number of connections.  The weakest points are the lack of adjustability in the base/ stand, and the sound is a bit weak.It is great as a wall mount set in a small room.This is another brand which I discovered through my kids.  My son bought a portable DVD player with his birthday money a few years back.  Because it was a big purchase (for a kid) he shopped very carefully. He bought a Coby tablet.  While I had never heard of the brand, I was impressed with the solid build.  It still travels with us and works as it did when new.  I hope this set holds up as well.  Thus far I am pretty impressed.

Reviews.Title: decent entry level HDTV, recommend for children's room or a smaller room with less distance to tv.
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "formerly a Road Warrior of t...
Reviews.Content: The Coby 2326 is a good entry level HDTV. It comes with basic inputs for cable/antenna, PC/SVGA 15 pin w/ stereo audio, component video, s-video and 1 HDMI post. There is no input for media card nor USB, this Coby will NOT work as a 23" digital photo frame as ships (for this feature perhaps connect a Roku 2 or similar device, mount the roku to the rear to camouflage from view.)Setup was a breeze and very intuitive. From opening the box, inspecting the unit, attaching the base, connecting the cables and scanning for channels, this model was fully functional within 10 minutes.The video quality is reasonable; the audio quality is acceptable. According to the energy label this device costs an average $6.72 in energy consumption based upon an average use of 5 hours per day at $0.11 per kilowatt hour at an estimated 61.09 kWh. Similar 21"-23" units run $4 - $13. According to the literature, this unit draws a max of 40 watts, includes ATSC/NTSC/QAM tv tuners, has v-chip parental control, is closed-caption for the hearing impaired and offers electronic program guide support.Included in the package:23" Coby LED 1080p HDTV w/remote and 2 AAA batteries6' Composite cable (red, white, yellow)Power cord (standard "computer" power cord)Stand (easy to put on and remove, thumb screw is included in the hollow base that is also removable.)This HDTV is SUPER SLIM and LIGHTWEIGHT! I generally mount the tv to the wall  (VESA 75mm x 75mm) but even someone very weak will be able to setup this HDTV or move it for cleaning. According to the box the overall dimensions of the HDTV itself is 22.6" wide by 14.5" tall (with a depth of maybe an inch) and with the base attached the overall dimension is 16.1" tall with a depth of 6.7". It also states extended backlight life expectancy is 20,000 hours.Caution: verify the return policy of the seller before ordering and inspect the box before accepting delivery. This HDTV needs another piece of foam between the HDTV and the box. Mine arrived with the box badly damaged, thankfully the HDTV arrived ok but really could have used an extra piece of foam to prevent damage to the unit during shipping.Coby Customer Service is 877-302-2629 (US) and 855-542-8917 (Canada)

Reviews.Title: Great Purchase!
Reviews.Author: djake02
Reviews.Content: Tv works great, looks great. Completly satisfied. I use it everday and have had no problems with it at all despite the few negative reviews I read.

Reviews.Title: Bad TV
Reviews.Author: Jesse "Jesse"
Reviews.Content: The sound went out on this TV right when the warranty ends.  Figures.  Now it's a terrible TV and I can't watch shows.

Reviews.Title: Coby TV
Reviews.Author: Tony
Reviews.Content: If going to use as a stand alone TV , Tuner is the worse only gets a couple of channels, used with an up graded antenna still no good. I know it's not the area a tubed tv with aconverter box works much better. Called manufacturer they stated tv was made to hook up to a cable box etc. I would not purchase this if you are going to use it as a stand alone TV.

Reviews.Title: Coby tv
Reviews.Author: Jim Williams
Reviews.Content: I bought this tv in April and when I tried to turn it on this morning it was completely dead. Very disappointing. When it worked the picture quality was good but the sound was "tinny". Coby does not exchange defective merchandise for free, they charge $75 allegedly for shipping and handling. Ridiculous. No more Coby products for me.

Reviews.Title: mrsammy
Reviews.Author: clyde
Reviews.Content: love the product! only problem i have is the HDMI slot on the back doesn't work correctly.and the tv. keeps shutting off when in HDMI mode. But for the Price the product is awesome. and the product delivery time was the best.

Reviews.Title: Coby 15" TV
Reviews.Author: Sandra Chausee
Reviews.Content: I just love this tv. Its perfect for my at homeoffice which is small and I like watching TV andworking at the same time. Perfect!!Sandra Chausee  Cape Cod Mass.

Reviews.Title: Excellent LED TV
Reviews.Author: Guss
Reviews.Content: Very good product, this little TV I use a lot for small spaces like the kitchen, is a good quality TV. I recommend purchasing this type of TV.

Reviews.Title: My Coby 23" LCD TV Stops Working in only 10 months
Reviews.Author: JayDeeMart
Reviews.Content: For the first 10 months I was happy with my low priced COBY LCD TV. Then is just stopped working (there had been no thunder storms for several days, so it wasn't fried by lightning.) It wouldn't turn on with either the remote or the set button.  While it was working the picture quality and sound was satisfactory. I was annoyed  that this was the first TV I have ever owned that would NOT work with any of the many universal remotes I owned.  The warranty is only 90 days for parts and labor, and 1 year for parts ONLY. It would cost me about about $70 to have this inferior TV repaired or replaced (their option). With a 90 day warranty, Coby obviously don't expect their TVs to last very long,  so I see no reason to invest more money in what seems to be an inferior product line.  It seems to me that Coby is another line of cheap Chinese made products that I should avoid in the future.

Reviews.Title: Both pay both you have.
Reviews.Author: Antonio Potenza
Reviews.Content: Both pay both you have. It's a cheap option and not too bad. Acceptable volume according with the size. Problems with the image depending on the angle of vision.

Reviews.Title: excellent little TV
Reviews.Author: Hawkyn M "Hawkyn"
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent little television.  The tuner picks up local Digital / HDMI channels clearly with a decent indoor antenna connected.  The picture quality is excellent for the size of the screen.  The set itself is extremely light.  The connection cluster is easy to access, well laid out, and has about any kind of connection you might want.  It also comes with a basic remote control - not mentioned in the description.  If you are looking for a small set to put in a spare bedroom, home office, or other tight space then this will be a good choice.

Reviews.Title: "Buyer Beware"
Reviews.Author: Raider Mike
Reviews.Content: Connected this unit to my PC and noticed immediately that the power button was "soft" and did not seem to engage properly. The first time that the unit timed out I could not get it to turn back on unless I unplugged / plugged it back in. After 4 days and doing the plug dance 4-5 times the unit just quit working all together, remote or unit power button un responsive, the light would just go out... The unit did not stick around long enough, so I did not get a chance to use the TV mode. Obviously I would not recommend. POS alert - stay away from Coby

Reviews.Title: Good kitchen TV for the price.  Fairly simple and low quality.
Reviews.Author: Bart
Reviews.Content: Pretty good and basic LCD tv for a low price.  I bought this tv to replace an old analog tv in the kitchen.  Since it was on sale for $80 right before Christmas 2011, I figured I'll give it a try.  Like I said, the tv is pretty simple and the remote is nothing fancy.  It is very light and the quality of it is not the greatest.  This tv did free up a lot of room on the kitchen counter compared to the old analog tv, so this is definitely a huge plus.  The viewing angle is not the greatest and the screen is angled upwards.  The screen angle cannot be adjusted.  What is really weird is that several times the tv turned on by itself.  Each time the remote was facing the tv, so maybe there was some sort of a glitch in the remote that turned it on?  Or maybe I have ghosts in my house... i don't know.  The picture quality, in my case is not the greatest because I do not have it connected to an HD box.  It is directly connected to a TV cable wire.  I have not tested this tv with an HD player so I dont know how great the picture would be in that case.Overall, if you are looking for a simple and not expensive tv, possibly for the kitchen than I would recommend this one.

Reviews.Title: Potentially a Bargain!
Reviews.Author: edcaroleg "Ed & Carole G."
Reviews.Content: Amazon had such a good price for this TV, that I decided to purchased it to replace an older 23", 480p TV that was mounted in our master bathroom. A standard definition satellite receiver transmits the signal to this TV via coaxial cable . Picture quality on the Coby is, surprisingly, considerable better than the receiver it replaces.We have several small TVs, (36" or less) both in our RV and in other rooms of our home, so, before installing it, I couldn't resist comparing the picture quality of the Coby with the others when connected to a 1080i program source. It's quality was not quite as sparkling as the Samsung, but, it was very good. Sound quality on all of these small TVs is poor, but the Coby is no worse than the others, in fact, it's a bit better than at least one of the others.The Coby appears to have a build quality comparable to any of the others. If it proves to be reliable, it is truly a bargain.

Reviews.Title: WOW what a great little tv!!!  LOVE IT
Reviews.Author: Jonathan Brosilo "lil j"
Reviews.Content: What can I say this is my first HD tv and I wanted LED but I didnt wanna spend to much and its for the basement.  I mean yeah ok if your looking for a big tv w big sound this isnt for you.  But for what i wanted this picture is sick!!!  I got a Monster High Speed HDMI cable for it and wow WOW the HD picture is sick!  Cant wait for the Nascar season to start up next Saturday thats why I got this tv!  I bought if for 137 at HH Greg and it was worth every penny.  AND I will be honest the picture on this COBY looked better than most other tvs at HH Greg and this one was the cheapest!  If I wanna get a bigger tv next year I will but I promise you I will be getting another COBY LED TV!PerfectUPDATE!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!  ITS DECEMBER 20TH 2012 AND MY COBY 23 INCH IS STILL GOING STRONG.  BEST TV IVE EVER SEEN.  THE PICUTRE IS FLAT OUT AMAZING.  IM SO IMPRESSED WITH COBY THAT I JUST GOT A COBY 3D SOUND BAR AS WELL.  COBY IS AWSOME THANKS GUYS.  WILL BE BUYING YOUR 55 INCH IN 2013!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: No picture
Reviews.Author: Barter Petunia "Real Estate Mogul/Grandma of 7"
Reviews.Content: I hooked it up, flipped the on/off switch to ON.  I got nothing.  No picture. Black screen. Sent it back.

Reviews.Title: Great picture quality and audio.
Reviews.Author: AccioFirebolt
Reviews.Content: I bought this for $99.99 during a Black Friday sale. I don't regret my purchase at all and I think it's worth the current asking price of $132.99.The picture quality is great and I think the audio is, too. Very crisp picture. I use this with a Roku player connected via HDMI cable and the picture is DVD quality or better.Perfect TV for a kids room or for someone who just wants a basic TV. I have this small one in my bedroom. It connects easily to a TV mount that I purchased for $20.I knock off one star because the stand for the TV is very generic and puts the TV at an odd angle that you can't adjust. Other than that, 5-star and I would recommend this TV.

Reviews.Title: GREAT TV
Reviews.Author: Mary J. Norman
Reviews.Content: JUST WHAT I NEEDED - A FEW LITTLE PROBLEMS LIKE BACKGROUND IMAGES ALL blurry and BLACK, MY OTHER COBY 13" TV had same problem, but stgraightened out over a little time like a week to get its kinks out. Sold out on this model 15" TV in two states and unable to special order it including from Best Buy.

Reviews.Title: Pretty good less expensive TV
Reviews.Author: Jon
Reviews.Content: I ordered this 19 inch TV on the cyber Monday sale. So far so good. The color was good for a bedroom TV. The only thing that doesn't work as well as I'm used to, is the sound. It sounds like it coming out the speaker of a cell phone. With some adjustment you can make it sound better.

Reviews.Title: great picture....poor sound
Reviews.Author: 1cherib
Reviews.Content: I ordered this television for a spot in my kitchen and while the picture is really good, the sound is like listening to an old transistor radio. We are looking for speakers to enhance the sound.

Reviews.Title: not that bad for the money
Reviews.Author: JOE SMITH
Reviews.Content: overall satisfied for what I paid...the sound is tinny but added a spare powered speaker system that I had and that solved the problem

Reviews.Title: Very Good Value
Reviews.Author: Eric Rivedal
Reviews.Content: I'm writing this for those of you who still use older technology in your homes. I have a high definition theater in my home, but then share the signal we watch in the theater with the rest of the house via standard definition transmission of composite signal via a radio frequency adapter (sends channel 3 over coaxial cable).This TV does a great job of displaying the standard definition signal as well as zooming in appropriately for the different ways that my source devices deliver that signal (with or without black bars). I haven't used it for high definition signals, but the quality of sound and picture is very good considering the source and the zoom options are sufficient to adapt to any source I have (cable box, Apple TV, Blu-Ray, etc.).It should be noted that I mounted this TV on a VESA wall mount and had to cut down the steel mounting plate in order to make room for the cables to plug in the back of it. The mounting holes are set at the 100mm standard and the cables are immediately below the lower mounting holes.This TV is an excellent value for the price and I would consider buying more of them as I replace older TV's in my house.

Reviews.Title: Not a bad TV
Reviews.Author: SMXSteve
Reviews.Content: We've had a 22 inch Coby for over a year and while other reviewers have had issues, ours still works. So now we have the 23 inch version. Not a lot of difference, in fact the only difference I can tell so far is how the power light is attached to the unit. This one has a separate piece of plastic which has already come loose.For an inexpensive TV this ok; it you watch a lot of TV I don't recommend it but if you want this for the bedroom, guest room, maybe kitchen, it's decent with a few issues:The power light can be turned off ONLY when watching it. So if it is in your bedroom the blue light might get annoying (black tape works but come on).The menu and other information including the channel number are a small font that are only usable if you are a couple feet away.Sound is sub par even though par on most TVs (if not all) is pretty weak. We have the one in the bedroom hooked up to a Bose® Solo TV Sound System.Slow to come on, slow to turn off, slow to change channels.Picture quality is ok but can be a bit too vivid but is adjustable.It has several connection options: cable, component, antenna, computer (VGA), HDMI, AV/RCA, S-Video. For audio it includes Coaxial and a headphone jack.We haven't had a problem (yet) so for an inexpensive TV for us it hasn't been a bad experience. I've rated it based on overall televisions, meaning it's OK but definitely not our entertainment system.

Reviews.Title: Love this t.v.
Reviews.Author: amanda122705
Reviews.Content: I have had this tv for about a week now we bought it to replace my sons old (big) tv in his room and me and my husband both just love it. It was easy to install their was nothing to it. The picture is nice and clear (we have digital cable) and its the perfect size for his space. would recommend and a great price.

Reviews.Title: Problem programming DISH satellite remote control
Reviews.Author: Aer O'Head
Reviews.Content: I guess I can't really give this a "real" review yet since I've only had the TV on for about 20 minutes setting it up. I got mine for $100 on a Lightning Deal, and so far it's looking like a dynamite bargain. The picture quality is good (for a 720p, of course) and the sound is a bit disappointing but it's good enough for my purposes. Plenty of input options on the backside, including coax, HDMI and RCA's. I was surprised when I called DISH network to program my remote control. They told me that they had nothing at all for COBY. I went through the manual looking for instructions or an equivalent, but I didn't find anything. (BTW, I'm guessing this problem is also true for those who use universal remotes.) If anybody knows of an equivalent, or knows the codes needed, I'd sure appreciate a posting. In the meanwhile ... while this TV isn't the best I've ever seen, I think it was a terrific bargain for the price and I'm very pleased with it.

Reviews.Title: good lcd tv
Reviews.Author: Andre "a"
Reviews.Content: I like this lcd tv a lot, it has good image quality and is thin and resistent enough for me to take away when I move out of my dorm. It could be better if it had a memory card reader and a built in dvd player but so far I like this tv a lot and I use it everyday.

Reviews.Title: Great HDTV with dismal sound
Reviews.Author: Robert Young "TampaRob"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this Coby 23" 1080p tv to replace an Insignia 19" HDTV that only went up to 1080i.  It has a beautiful picture and I'm impressed with it's total performance visually.  I patch my notebook PC into it to watch mainly DIVX/avi movies in HD and it does a great job.  My new Blu Ray player is excellent with it.  But the one glaring fault with this tv is it's miniscule, tinny sounding speakers which have to be turned almost all the way up to hear.  This surprises me because i have bought and set-up 5 Coby mp3 players, all having excellent sound (if you use non-Coby earbuds).  I'm using Realtek amplified speakers which I also use with my computer to remedy the sound problem.  With good external speakers, it's great.  That is the only reason I gave it 4 stars; the sound.  This TV is worth more than the approximately $200 I spent for it.  I hope Coby will make improvements, i'm a fan of their products so far.  I would highly recommend this HDTV, with the addition of external amplified speakers.

Reviews.Title: coby 15 inch tv
Reviews.Author: coogs
Reviews.Content: I was very disappointed with the Coby Tv IT HAD A BAD PICTURE AND VERY CRACKING SOUND may be it was just a one off duded or it did not work so well in australia. I found a never brand of TV on line it was a NEW BRAND TO AUSTRALIA [NEONIQ] it was very good the channels all set up auto and great picture and sound at the same price as the Coby but a 16 inch. AMOZON WERE VERY HELPFUL WITH MY RETURN. THANK YOU AMAZOM. WAYNE

Reviews.Title: You get what you pay for
Reviews.Author: J_seawater
Reviews.Content: I Bought this TV brand new in the sealed box from a big retail store. This TV was great for about 4 months. Never moving it, nor dropping it. then the image started flickering and cutting in and out, and turning off and on. Then one day it just didn't turn back on. Opened it up to find black melted wires, Coby only offers 90day warranty on its TV's, shows they lack confidence in their products.

Reviews.Title: Ok for the money but not able to watch HD content
Reviews.Author: Mike B.
Reviews.Content: For the price this is an acceptable TV.  I had read the reviews about the poor viewing angle (they aren't kidding) but I bought it for my wife who watches the TV from the side of the bed, so that is a non-issue.However, I am disappointed that we currently cannot view HD (720P or 1080i) content from Comcast.  When I bought the TV, one of the main reasons was the ability to hook the cable directly to the TV rather than going through the free Comcast digital to analog converter box we had hooked up to the old TV.  What I found is the QAM digital tuner in this TV works as advertised but it doesn't pickup all the channels that came through the converter box.When we had the Comcast converter (model DC50x) hooked to the old TV, we received about 114 channels; all standard def. due to the fact that the converter only passes SD via channel 3 or 4 on the output side.  When I hooked the cable directly to the Coby TV, it picked up only 67 channels (all digital as Comcast has switched to all digital in my area).  The HD channels it picked up (720P and 1080i) looked great; unfortunately most of my wife's favorite channels are not available.  So I had to put the converter box back in-line with the cable and have the TV tuned to SD channel 4.What a disappointment.  I told my wife the new TV would let her view her shows in HD, eliminate the converter box and thick cable that sits on top of the night stand, and she would only need one remote control. Now the only way for her to view HD channels is to rent another HD converter box (much larger box) and to increase our monthly Comcast bill by $10/month.So beware Comcast customers, this TVs digital turner only passes the basic channel set; and a number of the 67 channels are broadcast both in SD and HD so there are effectively <50 channels.

Reviews.Title: Unbelievable value!
Reviews.Author: S. Ghaemi
Reviews.Content: I was looking for 36inch TV for a couple of rooms in my house but everything was higher than my budget.  A friend of mine recommended the 40inch one from Coby.  I bought two.  I liked them so much and the value was so awesome that I ended up buying this 19inch one for my kitchen.The set up is a piece of cake and the quality of the picture is really nice for a 720p TV.  Look at the price.  How can you go wrong with this?

Reviews.Title: Coby 23in as a computer monitor
Reviews.Author: Corporal-Captain Radar
Reviews.Content: I purchased this HDTV specifically for use as an external monitor for my 2009 Macbook pro. I was unable to get the video to output at 1080p using the vga input, which was very frustrating(the HDMI worked great, but the video was fuzzy and colors very horendous even after color balancing with a spyder 3). After several hours trying to find solutions I finally figured it out and wanted to post it for anyone else having similar problems. Connect your computer via vga and open the TV menu. Under settings, click "computer settings and lower the phase( the phase is the tvs refresh rate. It needs to be at either 60 or 75 to match up with what your computer is outputting- at least with what my macbook is putting out). Mine was initially set at 86 and upon lowering it I was able to send signal in 1080p via the vga cable and am currently writing this review on this coby monitor in 1080p :).
